result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

records.addlTxt:
03:09 PM Defendant Edward Louis Daniel Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders matter continued at the request of Attorney Murphy.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:21 PM Defendant Edward Louis Daniel Jr. appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Jason D Sanders appeared by video on behalf of Michael Murphy for Edward Louis Daniel Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Matter continued for Attorney to be present.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact directly or indirectly with victim B.B., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.

3:15 PM Defendant Edward Louis Daniel Jr. appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Edward Louis Daniel Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Address verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Court orders $250 cash bond with conditions: No driving during pendency of case. Maintain absolute sobriety. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. No contact directly or indirectly with victim B.B., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
